description: Dive into "Fethiye's Picture-Perfect Hidden Gems" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Fethiye's Picture-Perfect Hidden Gems

places.generalDescription: Paspatur √áar≈üƒ±sƒ±, also known as Fethiye Old Town, is a charming area located near the marina and ancient sites. The town boasts low-rise buildings due to historical earthquakes, adding to its allure. Visitors can explore authentic food markets, old stone buildings, and picturesque Umbrella Street adorned with colorful umbrellas.

sources.snippet: Paspatur is the official name for Fethiye‚Äôs old town, which lies an easy walk from the marina and several top ancient sites. The area has suffered devastating earthquakes repeatedly over millennia, and so the whole town comprises low-rise buildings, adding to Paspatur‚Äôs charm. Wandering, you‚Äôll happen upon authentic food markets, old stone homes and little pavement caf√©s, as well as photogenic ‚ÄòUmbrella Street, hung with colourful brollies that keep the scorching sun at bay.
sources.shortName: 21 of the best things to do in Fethiye

sources.snippet: There's a long promenade along the waterfront, small shops, a lively fish market, and a popular photo spot in a street under a canopy of dozens of strung-up umbrellas. On the other side of the bay is serene √áalƒ±≈ü Plajƒ± beach. Outside Fethiye, places to explore include √ñl√ºdeniz and its blue lagoon, and the abandoned town of Kayak√∂y.

places.name: Paspatur Old Town (Eski ≈ûehir)

reviews.text: I loved this place. it's full of good restaurants and coffee shops. Everything you need you can find in paspatur and especially the souvenirs. I went many times and always enjoy my time there.

A must see to experience some Old Town culture with a mix of shopping for traditional foods, spices and "genuine fakes". It's NOT open 24hrs a day, the shops/cafes & bars start to open around 10am and close at midnight. Quieter in the morning busier at night, shaded so won't be in direct sun whilst shopping.
Good variety of shops from clothing to souvenirs, always barter to get the price down and shop around - they prefer cash payments but do except card! Look out for the turtle üê¢ in the duck pond.

Love this old town.  The markets are undercover. You can buy all sorts of stuff , you will need to bargain as some items need a reduced price to be a good deal. Probably get 25-40% off initial asking price. All the fake items seem quite good quality.
What out for cash vs credit card for pricing.

places.generalDescription: The Amyntas Rock Tombs, dating back to the 4th century BCE, are a remarkable series of burial caves carved directly into the cliff face that served as the resting place for ancient Lycians over 2500 years ago. These classical tombs feature columned porticos and offer stunning views of Fethiye marina and the bay.

sources.snippet: The Tomb of Amyntas is an old Lycian tomb located within walking distance from Fethiye‚Äôs old town. It is a great walk that takes you through some local streets and gives you a new perspective away from Fethiye‚Äôs touristy center. The walk is a little steep, and there are some steps once you reach the tomb, so be ready for a bit of exercise.
sources.shortName: 17 Popular Things to Do in Fethiye, Turkey (With Video)

sources.snippet: Ancient Rock Tombs: Fethiye is home to impressive ancient rock tombs carved into the cliffs. These architectural marvels provide an opportunity to capture a blend of history, culture, and natural beauty.
sources.shortName: Most Photography Places in Fethiye | Experience | Blog

sources.snippet: The Lycian rock tombs carved into the cliffs at Amyntas, located on the edge of Fethiye town. Or the ruins of the historic city of Tlos, and the ghost village of Kayak√∂y are just a short drive away.
A bit of a pull, but climb up to the main Lycian rock tombs in Fethiye ‚Äì the tomb of Amyntas ‚Äì and take in the amazing views of Fethiye marina. And the whole of the bay.
sources.shortName: 25+ Best Things To Do In Fethiye, Turkey (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: Fethiye Rock Tombs: Climb up to the main Lycian rock tombs in Fethiye- the Tomb of Amyntas ‚Äì and take in the amazing views of Fethiye marina and the whole of the bay.

sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Fethiye (Turkey)

places.name: Amyntas Rock Tombs

reviews.text: There is a nominal fee to enter - you can see the tombs from afar without entering, but you can walk right up and peek inside one of the tombs with the entrance fee and it was worth it to me! It's a steep walk, but very short. Yo could be in and out in 20 minutes. We happened to be at the top when the call to prayer happened and it was incredible with the echo and hearing multiple voices ‚ù§Ô∏è Magic. Also, the view was amazing.

If you're in history and ancient ruins you will like it, but if you're coming for adventure or hiking it is not the best place to be.

The stairs are easy and take you to one place only which is the ‚Äúburial room‚Äù.

You can watch the sunset with sea view which fantastic.
Definitely worth the visit, these tombs are fascinating. My friend and I had a great time exploring and climbing closer to get a sneak peak. One of my highlights from Fethiye ‚ú®

places.generalDescription: √áalƒ±≈ü Beach is a stunning sandy beach in Fethiye, Turkey, offering a perfect setting for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying breathtaking sunsets. The area is known for its vibrant atmosphere with numerous bars and restaurants. Fethiye boasts an array of beautiful beaches including the famous Oludeniz beaches with crystal clear waters ideal for water sports. The region also offers opportunities for hot air balloon rides and exploration from above.

sources.snippet: This sandy stretch west of town is the closest Fethiye gets to a city beach. People come for watersports and turtle-spotting as well as g on strolls people-watchingon wanders along the expansive promenade. Pull up a chair at one of the bars and restaurants along the seafront ‚Äî they come into their own as the sun goes down beyond the island across the bay, turning the darkening day into a magical spectacle of colour.
sources.shortName: 21 of the best things to do in Fethiye

sources.snippet: Experience the breathtaking sunset at Calis Beach, where the sky paints a stunning backdrop for a romantic evening stroll. Fethiye offers a plethora of couple-friendly destinations that will ignite the spar..
sources.shortName: Fethiye's Photography Spots: Instagram-Worthy Locations | Travel Tips | Blog

sources.snippet: Calis Beach: This wide, sandy beach is perfect for relaxing photos. Photograph the beach promenade, the sunsets over the sea or the traditional boats moored here.
sources.shortName: Fethiye's Instagram Highlights: Top Photo Spots 2024

places.name: √áalƒ±≈ü Beach

reviews.text: It's a beautiful beach, a romantic place with friendly people, especially at Jive Beach Resort. It's relaxing, offers excellent food, and provides outstanding service.

Lovely beach, pretty long, nice for a walk. I spent 6 weeks there next to the beach in December 2024 and January 2025 and liked it. It's partly dark sand, the rest are stones. Usually clean. Mountain view in the background and islands around were a bonus. Nice for sunsets. Many locals go there with chairs and tables and eat and drink.

Some parts of the beach were quiet, mostly on week days, but it got too busy on weekends and in the afternoona in general. As an introvert, I would not enjoy the Calis beach in summer when it gets overcrowded. In winter it was still fine for me on weekdays.

What I did not enjoy: way too many people smoking on the beach, they do not care at all if there's any non-smokers around (for a lifelong non-smoker, it was disgusting to me). And also many locals were fishing there, jus anywhere among other people who went there for a swim (yes, I did go for a swim even in winter when the water was not very warm but that's why I was staying next to the beach) and it was bothering having to check the fishing sticks and lines all around me. It's very inconsiderate that the fishermen do not stick to the end of the beach in order not to disturb other people who are not on the beach for fishing.

As someone who has spent her entire life in Fethiye-from birth through childhood and high school-I'd like to share a few thoughts about √áalƒ±≈ü Beach (√áalƒ±≈ü Plajƒ±).

Let me say this upfront: the water at √áalƒ±≈ü isn't the cleanest or most pristine you'll find. That's a fact anyone can figure out, whether they're visiting for the first time or have lived here for years. But the real charm of √áalƒ±≈ü isn't in its water quality-it's in the experience.

√áalƒ±≈ü is one of those rare beaches where you can walk barefoot on soft sand, where the shore doesn't feel like it's fenced off or commercialized with a cordon or barrier. You're not forced to pay high entrance fees, buy overpriced drinks, or reserve a sunbed just to enjoy the sea. There's a quiet kind of justice in that. You can just be.

The view here is stunning, especially at sunset-one of the best in all of Fethiye. You can grab a cold beer from a nearby bakkal, walk down to the beach, and enjoy it with your loved ones without bothering anyone. It's that simple. That free. You can walk, breathe, watch the Knight Island across the bay, and feel like you're in a space that welcomes you as you are.

There are wonderful restaurants around too-especially fish restaurants-and the pubs feel just right for Fethiye. The atmosphere is unpretentious, friendly, and open. √áalƒ±≈ü offers a kind of democratic beauty-natural and social-that makes the friendships and memories you form here feel extra special and lasting.

That said, I also want to offer a sincere warning. The water here may look calm and inviting, but it can get surprisingly deep after just a few steps. I say this as someone who nearly drowned here as a child, despite being a strong swimmer today. If you don't know how to swim, don't go in alone. It's deceptive. The sea bottom drops quickly, and before you know it, you're in over your head. There's also a fair amount of underwater moss, which might feel unpleasant or slippery.

So please-enjoy √áalƒ±≈ü, but do so with care. Let yourself go with the flow, but not without a sense of awareness and respect for the sea.

places.generalDescription: Ada Restaurant Sovalye Island is a charming dining spot situated on the picturesque Sovalye Island, offering a tranquil and exclusive experience accessible by boat. The restaurant features a menu with Mediterranean and Turkish influences, showcasing an array of delightful dishes. Accessible via a 15-minute shuttle boat ride from Calis beach, the island offers cafes, beaches, and beautiful villas to explore. Additionally, visitors can enjoy stunning sunset views from the restaurant's location across Calis Fethiye Beach.

sources.snippet: Off the coast of Fethiye lies a cluster of beautiful, quirky islands, with residents yet completely unspoilt. Sovalye, within sight of town, is just 15 minutes away on the shuttle boat from Calis beach, home to a scattering of caf√©s and some lovely villas. On Gemiler island are the ruins of ancient churches, while the more isolated Gocek outcrops are tailor-made for nature lovers.
sources.shortName: 21 of the best things to do in Fethiye

places.name: Ada Restaurant Sovalye Island

reviews.text:
In restaurants like this usually the most important is the view ,but not at Ada restaurant !
The food was extremely delicious ,the service excellent and this is the first time I've eat baked halva !
As you can see the view was outstanding !By mistake I've booked a wrong date, but we were accommodated at the best table .
Thank you very much
Absolutely wonderful place very romantic , picked up by ferry at the jetty , great food great staff can't fault this place
Amazing sunset view point! Chill vibe, not so busy. But I personally found food to be way overpriced for its quality.

places.address: Fethiye Adasƒ± - ≈û√∂valye Adasƒ± No: 61, Sovalye Island, 48300 Fethiye/Muƒüla, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Castle of Fethiye, although currently closed to the public and designated as an excavation site, offers a picturesque setting with impressive cacti and plenty of tortoises. The hill leading up to the castle is strewn with broken glass, so visitors are advised to watch their step. Despite being mostly destroyed, a few towers still stand, providing an excellent vantage point for panoramic views of Fethiye.

sources.snippet: I spent an entire summer in Fethiye, Turkey and in that time I came to understand not only its beauty but its traditions too. There are many Fethiye attractions that suit beach lovers, but it‚Äôs a destination that‚Äôs packed with so much history that you could say it‚Äôs almost like an open-air museum.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things To Do in Fethiye, Turkey

places.name: Castle of Fethiye

reviews.text: It is a castle ruin. No entrance fee and there is a sign to not climb the castle.

Castle of Fehtiye is mostly ruins. You can walk around but be careful because of slippery stones. But the best reason why it's a worth going here is beautiful scenery to Fethiye, sea, mountains!  For walking 30 minutes will be enough for enjoying this place üòâ
The castle is mostly destroyed. There are couple of towers left. Best place to enjoy the panoramic view of the Fethiye

places.generalDescription: The Ancient City of Telmessos, located on the border between Lycia and Karya in Turkey, is renowned for its impressive temples and cliff-hewn constructions. It was a center of prophecy with a strong influence on Fethiye's history. Surviving monuments like stone tombs, Lycian sarcophagi, the Rhodes fortress, and the Roman Theatre attest to its culturally rich Hellenistic and Roman periods.

sources.snippet: In the 5th century BC Telmessos was the largest city in the Lycian Union, the area that now stretches between Antalya and Fethiye. Over millennia it changed hands and names countless times, eventually becoming Makri, a Greek settlement. Much has disappeared with the emergence of modern Fethiye, but impressive sights endure today: chief among these are the huge amphitheatre and the Lycian rock tombs built into the cliffs above town.
sources.shortName: 21 of the best things to do in Fethiye

places.name: Ancient City of Telmessos

reviews.text:
You will need to pay 3 euro in cash to enter. Make sure to prepare first. They dont accept lira.

This place is good place to visit if you enjoy observing historical sites and building. I also brought some sandwich and drink to enjoy at the cliff side while looking at Fethiye views. The view is totally worth it.

absolutely amazing, to soak up the history at dusk, but also to clamber among the remains and spot tortoises basking in the afternoon sun. It's not just a few ruins, but a whole hill side of slowly decaying houses, being taken back by nature. I would return time and time again if I could.

This is one of the most fabulous ruins I visited in all of Turkey. It's for unique because it has not been unearthed or changed from its actual present state which means everywhere you walk you are seeing history lying on the ground in rubble. It says, though you walked into this place as the first person to see it in 1000 years. It is a strenuous walk, so be prepared.

places.generalDescription: If you're on the lookout for a vibrant artistic experience, Maya Home Perde is a must-visit. This charming spot showcases an array of colorful oil paintings by the talented local artist Bahar Barutcu from Fethiye. Her artwork captures dynamic human figures in motion, bringing life and energy to each piece. It's a delightful destination for art lovers seeking inspiration and creativity amidst their travels!

sources.shortName: Fethiye's Photography Spots: Instagram-Worthy Locations | Travel Tips | Blog

places.generalDescription: The Fethiye Peninsula offers an 8-mile circular walk along the road, providing stunning views and a chance to visit Mete Beach. The beach boasts natural beauty with clean, rocky waters and a pier for diving into 2.5-3 meters of depth. It's a great spot to catch the sunset. The area is serene and perfect for enjoying the beautiful sea view, making it an ideal place for a peaceful getaway or a refreshing run amidst clean surroundings.

sources.shortName: 25+ Best Things To Do In Fethiye, Turkey (2025 Guide)

places.name: The Scenery of Fethiye Peninsula

reviews.text: Beautiful scenery, only viewed from a bostana trip, but really outstanding!

Enjoyable run

beautifull
